page.title: 04EARNSLOW GRANGE, WHITEGATE
page.content: The present owner has lived on the farm for 20 years. The farmer has 80 milking cows, 27 large heifers and 29 other cows. Approximately 85 calves are born each year. Some are sold but most are kept. The owner also grows cereals - wheat and barley. The wheat is sold and the barley is kept for winter feed. The farm consists of 278 acres. This includes all the cows' fields and all the cereal fields. There are 120 acres for cereals and 130 acres of grassland. The remaining acres are waste and woodland. There are 85-90 tonnes of fertilizers used each year, 30 tonnes of nitrogen and 60 tonnes of other compounds. The owner does not mind using fertilizers and weedkillers because the soil is very sandy with little goodness but excellent drainage.
